WESTERN AIRLINES
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
INFORMACION IMPORTANTE
You are flying aboard an aircraft with a Flight Crew which
is trained and thoroughly experienced. It is extremely
unlikely that certain safety facilities will be needed, but
simply as a precaution we would like you to be familiar with
these features.
Ud. esta volando a bordo de una aeronave que cuenta con
una tripulación de vuelo que ha acumulado una gran experi-
encia en navegación. Esta experiencia la han adquirido por
medio de un intenso entrenamiento en todos sus aspectos.
Es sumamente remoto que los equipos de seguridad con que
cuenta este avión sean utilizados, pero como precaución,
nos agradaria que Ud. se familiarizara con estos equipos.
SEAT BELTS
Even if the "SEAT BELT" sign is turned off in flight, it is
recommended that you keep your seat belt fastened, when -
ever you are in your seat.
CINTURONES DE SEGURIDAD
Aún cuando el aviso
CINTURON DE SEGURIDAD
haya
sido apagado durante el vuelo, es recomendable que man-
tenga dicho cinturón puesto mientras Ud. se encuentre en
su asiento.

SEATBACKS AND TRAY TABLES
Federal Aviation Regulations require your seatback and tray
table to be upright and locked during taxi, take off and land-
Ing.
ASIENTOS
Los respaldos y mesas deberan estar en posición vertical
durante el despegue, aterrizaje y siempre que la aeronave
este en movimiento.
NO SMOKING
When the "'NO SMOKING'' sign is off you may smoke ciga-
retts only in the smoking section. Whenever the "NO SMOK-
ing"'
sign comes on, however, all cigaretts must be exting-
uished.
NO FUMAR

NO FUMAR

para esto. Sin embargo, al aparecer el aviso de
NO FUMAR,

BOEING 727 EMERGENCY EXITS
STEPLOTA
re nine exits provided for vour use on this airolane. The
chart below will show you the one closest to your seat. wear the
center of the cabin. over the wing, are four window exits.
There are tour exit doors: two are forward, and two are in the
rear, and are equipped with fast operating evacuation slides.
In addition, there is a center back door exit equipped with stairs.
